title: Riot doesn't know how to balance Melee carries
body:
Or carries in general
this game is going nowhere
The reason marksmen are meta is because of the combination of this:
-insane laning phase against melees in 2v2
-insane objective control
-too safe making the lack of range a huge punishement

Now the laning phase is being fixed with FFW nerf and base stats nerf
As an adc main I can testify that NOTHING can manage to properly lane bot lane against an adc+support
not even ranged mages because to apply pressure they need to use their spells and eventually will end up out of mana, while adcs can still basic attack if they don't have mana. And even if you manage to take a good trade against them they will sustain everything back.

The objective control is being nerfed because IE damage will only work against champions

now, we still have the third problem and this is where riot is fucking up so hard
marksmen are too safe, so what do we do to convince players to play melees? we turn them into tanks

Spirit of shojin or idr the name is the example of this
**I do agree that melees need ways to avoid damage** they're not ranged, they're melees and take risks. This is why I don't mind yasuo windwall, if he didn't have this he couldn't work because he would die instantly
Do you realise the difference between this item and windwall? that's right, **one takes SKILL to use**. windwall needs a good timing, if you  use it for nothing the oppenents won't use spells against it and you won't absorb any damage, then since it has 20 sec cd you're going to get fucked up in teamfight.
Now you give all melees, flat damage reduction WITHOUT DOING ANYTHING.
We already struggle to deal with Yasuo/Vayne with {{item:3046}} , so we decided to add even more free tankiness without any inbuilt counterplay

You know why melees work in Dota2? because they have this item called black king bar, where you have to activate it at the right time to dodge spells or cc, where if you don't use it in time you get chain cc'ed (because unlike olaf ult you can't use it during ccs) and DIE.

Spirit of shojin should have been a 350 hp morgana black shield on active instead of a retarded damage reduction

But you know what else is a problem?

{{item:3031}} {{item:3087}} {{item:3094}} those items have the same problem
only stats, nothing should be used at the right time
to a point where riot buffs crit cost when it's shit, then nerf it once again when it's overpowered, and will never ever balance crit

I guess this is the state of the game, a game slowly returning to stat checking each others

I think part of the problem with melee champions in League right now is that the game is so oversaturated with cheap anti-melee gameplay, that melee champions need something equally cheap and overly strong to have a chance at carrying. The reason we have bullshit mechanics on champions like Yasuo, Nasus, Yi, etc. is because that is the amount of power required for them to even stand a chance of surviving teamfights, let alone have real agency past mid game. Frequently, even this is not enough, as champions like Nasus and Yasuo, both intended to be carries, tend to fall off precisely because they're still not good at teamfighting. Tanky champions in League still get melted far quicker than in any other MOBA, and the sheer amount of CC around, particularly CC that is easy to apply at melee range, means it's not all that uncommon for melee champions in teamfights to find themselves stunlocked for their entire lifespan. In this respect, because there is so much that melee champions can't really outplay, the quickest solution to have them carry would indeed be to give them something with equally little counterplay.

Personally, though, I agree that this is a terrible mode of balance, and I'd much rather Riot made a real effort to balance the game properly around melee champions, instead of trying to pull a Dota 2 and respond to something broken with another, equally broken set of mechanics. Right now, the game is very clearly balanced around ranged champions in mind, as there are a whole bunch of mechanics that screw over melee champions automatically, or otherwise act as if all champions were at a certain distance from each other. Even some melee champions are balanced in complete ignorance of other melee champions, which is why so many juggernauts tend to auto-win melee combat whenever they're strong. On top of that, the fact that every champion has, on average, one hard CC and one soft CC effect, often more than that, means that in combination with CDR creep it's not particularly costly or difficult to dump all of that CC onto any incoming melee champion. This is made all the worse by the fact that these mechanics are often conveyed through skillshots, as opposed to ground-targeted effects or the like, which cause those effects to have fine counterplay at a distance, but little to none at point-blank range. Coupled with the excessive amounts of damage overall in the game, and it's effectively impossible for a melee champion to do their job of going into heated group fights without either getting obliterated, or having to pull some obscene shit like total unstoppability, damage immunity, and so on.

**TL;DR:** As long as League continues to have too much damage, too much CC, and too much of it conveyed through mechanics with little to no counterplay at melee range, melee champions, especially melee carries, will never be able to function properly without having some equally unfair mechanics in response. Spear of Shojin offers one such mechanic, one I think is a band-aid to the larger problem that will only make the overall environment less healthy in the long run. If Riot truly wants fighters, melee carries, etc. to be more viable, then they need to do a game-wide pass where they desaturate all of the excessive damage, crowd control, possibly CDR, etc., that has been added to the game over time, and reevaluate what remains to make sure it has outplay potential at melee range. Only then will melee champions be able to function properly without requiring low-counterplay mechanics of their own each time.

Melee carries work in DotA because of far more than BKB. It's not even a required item.
They work because ranged autoattacks don't dictate lane control at level 1, damage block items with melee bonuses exist, melee heros have MASSIVE base stat advantages over ranged heros, and ranged heros don't get kiting, self peel, long range, mobility, and high dps all in one.

Okay, one, kiting isn’t a benefit in the same way mobility and high range are. Kiting is gameplay mechanic found in all classes if your range matches/exceeds your opponent, eg every ranged character with ranged abilities can kite. Even Melee champs can kite if they have decent ranged skills.

So ignoring kiting, a lot of ranged heroes in DotA do have self peel, good range, mobility and DPS if they purchase certain items. Drow’s kit is a massive fuck you to all non-spell immune enemies + Shadow Blade. Hurricane Pike is self-peel for any ranged right clicker to buy.

Melee carries work in DotA because turn rate, overtuned stats and a lot of brainless mobility, hard CC and crits built into their kits. Having inherent crit in your kit is far superior than having to a waste a precious item slot on crit. Ranged heroes in DotA have more access to DPS, mobility, and self peel, even when their kit has NONE, than any League champion can dream of.

They have items they can purchase to cover their weaknesses - that's fine. Champions like Tristana have all of that built into their kit so they can simply stack the most DPS possible. At least you have to buy the hurricane pike.
They also don't have strong early games like Caitlyn or Xayah with a strong lategame. Carries with strong early games in DotA don't scale nearly as hard as their counterparts in league.

Sure, in DotA, you won’t have Quinn boning Darius all lane long, instead they’ve opted into tri-lanes to deny the farming carry even harder than League’s standards.

Carries in League are largely fine. Melee’s here are only bad because Riot’s design philosophy (counterable at all stages of the game) favors range. If we gave Yi and Tryn hard CC and better crit steriods, they’d run over any ranged champion in a heartbeat. Yasuo is already some proof what happens when you give a melee carry some agency.

Ranged champions should be slippery and fragile. Melee should be made more durable, but the problem is obscene damage and being durable is a huge turn-off for League’s community.

These items are the EXACT way to balance melee carries, with one caveat.

They're not melee exclusive.

Lack of melee exclusivity has been a plague upon Riot's balance for ages, because any item which is good on melee winds up being better on ranged due attack range being nothing but a bonus.

This has been the problem with NUMEROUS items introduced to help melee; Gauge & Ruined King are great examples of items designed and implemented with the intent of being 'for melee', which were subsequently brutalized because of ranged abusers.

From what I've gathered over the years of playing dating back to Riven's release I've noticed every fighter type champion has been designed with repeatable mobility with a low cooldown and momentary survivability. 

Since then we've seen 
{{champion:24}}  dodge become timed 
{{champion:114}} old and new Riposte (both timed)
{{champion:157}} wind wall
{{champion:92}} shield duration reduced
{{champion:164}} passive and ulti i-frame
{{champion:5}} current ulti
{{champion:141}} ulti intangablity
{{champion:39}} current W

Generally these skills will trigger a fight or flight decision, do I expend this moment to go even and get a kill or two? Or do I just let it end and make a run for it?
After choosing one or the other, you're more like to stick to that decision as those abilities tend to have long cooldowns. After which they become extremely vulnerable. Some more than others. 

So I would say that those changes have been methods of correcting this stat-check gameplay.

However some still exist in the form of "I'm going to do this thing, and 1 of two things are going to happen. 1) I'm going to win this fight because I'm 1 whole kill ahead of you or 2) I'm not going to lose because I'm still 1 whole kill ahead of you."

{{champion:23}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:78}} {{champion:10}} {{champion:2}} {{champion:77}} {{champion:80}} {{champion:48}} 

Many times when going against the latter group, almost any choice you make in order to stay even may be incredibly regretful. But when playing as them
they tend to not have as much of an exposed weakness than the former group. The latter group have kits with contingencies to fall back on such as lifesteal/healing/resets/passive triggers whereas the first group mentioned need to purchase/build in order access to them.
